revision.text: {| class="wikitable" !'''''[[Gluster_File_System_Documentation | Home!!]]''''' |} ==== Tutorials ==== Jeff Darcy was kind enough to write up some tutorials on his blog all about getting started with translators. See links to the four articles below: * [http://hekafs.org/index.php/2011/11/translator-101-class-1-setting-the-stage/ Translator 101 - Setting the Stage] * [http://hekafs.org/index.php/2011/11/translator-101-lesson-2-init-fini-and-private-context/ Translator 101 - Init, Fini and Private Context] * [http://hekafs.org/index.php/2011/11/translator-101-lesson-3-this-time-for-real/ Translator 101 - This Time for Real] * [http://hekafs.org/index.php/2011/11/translator-101-lesson-4-debugging-a-translator/ Translator 101 - Debugging a Translator] ==== Current Translator Status ==== Here is a list of all known translators, with their current status and maintainers. We will gradually add pages for each translator to more easily track and participate in their development. ==== Translator Types ==== Note: This list is not comprehensive and is a work in progress. This is an attempt to offer architectural background and understanding. Note to devs: If explanations of translator types listed here are not correct, please update them accordingly. These are descriptions based on best effort understanding of what has been published. {| !Translator Type !Functional Purpose |- |[http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Translators/storage Storage] |Lowest level translator, stores and accesses data from local file system. |- |[http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Translators/debug Debug] |Provide interface and statistics for errors and debugging. |- |[http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Translators/cluster Cluster] |Handle distribution and replication of data as it relates to writing to and reading from bricks & nodes. |- |[http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Translators/encryption Encryption] |Extension translators for on-the-fly encryption/decryption of stored data. |- |[http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Translators/protocol/client Protocol] |Interface translators for client / server authentication and communications. |- |[http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Translators/performance Performance] |Tuning translators to adjust for workload and I/O profiles. |- |[http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Arch/Understanding_Various_Translators#Translator_Inventory Bindings]* |Add extensibility, e.g. The Python interface written by Jeff Darcy to extend API interaction with GlusterFS. |- |[http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Arch/Understanding_Various_Translators#Translator_Inventory System]* |System access translators, e.g. Interfacing with file system access control. |- |[http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Translators/cluster/unify#GlusterFS_Schedulers Scheduler] |I/O schedulers that determine how to distribute new write operations across clustered systems. |- |[http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Translators/features Features] |Add additional features such as Quotas, Filters, Locks, etc. |} * - No dedicated context page.
